lite.title: Closure Lite
lite.description: A shorter version that captures the essentials for safety, stabilization, and next steps.

full.title: Closure Full
full.description: A deeper version for nuance, patterns, and longer-term healing support.

q01.title: Where You Are in the Timeline
q01.prompt: First, a few grounding facts so this can meet you where you are. What is the timing of the ending and how long was the relationship?

fields.label: How long ago did it end (or change) for real?
If you know it: what date did it end? (or the day you found out)
How long were you together (roughly)?
Notes (optional)
fields.placeholder: Anything about the timing that matters.

examples: Days ago. End date: Jan 20, 2026. Length: 6 to 12 months.
Weeks ago. End date: early December. Length: 2 to 6 months.
It is complicated or unclear. End date: (blank). Length: 3 to 7 years.

q02.title: What Kind of Ending Was This
q02.prompt: What best describes the ending you are navigating?

options.label: Relationship structure changed (open to closed, etc.)

examples: Breakup (dating relationship ended)
Separation (not divorced yet)
Ghosted or slow-faded

q03.title: What It Was Right Before It Ended
q03.prompt: Right before it ended, what was the relationship status or structure?
examples: Exclusive (not engaged/married)
Engaged
Casually dating

q04.title: Practical Entanglements
q04.prompt: Were there any practical entanglements that make this harder to unwind? (Select any that apply.)

options.label: Legal process involved (divorce, restraining order, custody)

examples: Lived together + Shared finances or debt + Pets together
Children together or co-parenting + Legal process involved (divorce, restraining order, custody)
None of these

q05.title: Physical Intimacy Level
q05.prompt: Only if you are comfortable: what best describes the physical side of the relationship?

options.label: Light affection only (hand-holding, hugs, brief kisses)
Living as partners (shared bed, frequent sex)

examples: Light affection only (hand-holding, hugs, brief kisses)
Sex (intercourse)
Prefer not to say

q06.title: Current Contact Status
q06.prompt: What is your current contact situation with them?

options.label: On and off contact (hard to keep boundaries)
We are actively talking or trying to repair
I blocked them or they blocked me

examples: No contact
Limited contact for logistics only
On and off contact (hard to keep boundaries)

q07.title: What You Need Most Right Now
q07.prompt: If this could help you with just one thing today, what would you choose? (Select up to 3.)

options.label: Calm my body (less panic, less tightness)
Closure so I can let go
A boundary plan (no contact, social media, etc.)
A simple plan to move forward

examples: Calm my body (less panic, less tightness) + Sleep or rest better
Stop the rumination loop + A boundary plan (no contact, social media, etc.) + Stabilize my self-worth
Closure so I can let go

q08.title: Overall Emotional Intensity
q08.prompt: On a 0 to 10 scale, how emotionally intense has this been for you overall? (0 = barely, 10 = consuming)

q09.title: How It Felt Inside the Relationship
q09.prompt: When you think back, what words describe how it felt most of the time? (Select up to 5.)
examples: Safe + Joyful + Steady
Exciting + Anxious + Unpredictable
Confusing + Emotionally distant + Lonely even together

q10.title: What Was Good About It
q10.prompt: What felt genuinely good or healthy about the relationship? (Select up to 4.)

options.label: It is hard to name right now

examples: Friendship and fun + Shared values
Strong chemistry + Personal growth
It is hard to name right now

q11.title: What Was Hard About It (Ranked)
q11.prompt: What were the biggest pain points? Select the ones that fit and drag to rank the top ones.

options.label: Pressure around pace, intimacy, or commitment

examples: Conflict cycles, Communication breakdown, Avoidance or emotional shutdown
Trust issues or betrayal, Pressure around pace, intimacy, or commitment
Values or life direction mismatch, Distance/logistics

q12.title: Overall Pattern
q12.prompt: Looking back, what was the overall pattern?

options.label: Slow burn that grew over time

examples: Rollercoaster (high highs, low lows)
Fast and intense early on
Mostly steady and consistent

q13.title: Markers of Integration
q13.prompt: Which of these were true at any point? (This helps gauge how intertwined your lives became.)
examples: Met each other's family + Traveled together + Talked seriously about the future
Shared holidays/traditions + Attended the same church/community events
None of these

q14.title: Your Stress Pattern in Relationships
q14.prompt: When the relationship felt uncertain, what did you tend to do? (Select what fits, no shame.)
examples: Overthink and scan for signs + Seek reassurance or closeness
Withdraw or go quiet + Avoid hard conversations
Stay relatively centered

q15.title: What You Were Hoping For
q15.prompt: In your most honest words, what were you hoping this would become?
examples: I wanted a calm, committed partnership where we build a life together.
I hoped we would keep dating and see if the foundation was real.
I thought this might become marriage, and I was letting myself believe it.

q16.title: What You Were Afraid Of
q16.prompt: What were you afraid might happen, even if you did not say it out loud?
q16.placeholder: If this feels tender, go gentle. A few lines is enough.
examples: That I would get attached and they would leave anyway.
That I would lose myself trying to make it work.
That the red flags were real and I was ignoring them.

q17.title: Who Ended It
q17.prompt: Who initiated the ending (or the big shift) most directly?

options.label: Something external forced it (distance, family, health, legal)

examples: They ended it
It was mutual
Something external forced it (distance, family, health, legal)

q18.title: How It Ended
q18.prompt: How did it end (or how did you find out it was ending)?

options.label: Slow fade (less and less until it died)

examples: In-person conversation
Text message
Ghosted / disappeared

q19.title: How Sudden Was It
q19.prompt: Did it feel sudden, or did it build over time?

options.label: Sudden (felt like it came out of nowhere)
Some signs, but I still hoped it would work
It was part of an on/off pattern

examples: Some signs, but I still hoped it would work
Sudden (felt like it came out of nowhere)
Long time coming

q20.title: Primary Reasons (Ranked)
q20.prompt: What do you believe were the main reasons it ended? Select what fits and rank the top ones.

options.label: Conflict cycle that would not repair

examples: Values or life direction mismatch, Emotional unavailability or distancing, Communication breakdown
Trust rupture or betrayal, Conflict cycle that would not repair
Commitment timing mismatch, Distance or logistics

q21.title: How Much Closure You Got
q21.prompt: How clear was the explanation or conversation around the ending?

options.label: Clear and respectful (I understand the why)

examples: Somewhat clear (still gaps)
No explanation
Clear and respectful (I understand the why)

q22.title: Unanswered Questions
q22.prompt: What questions are still looping in your mind?
q22.placeholder: Example: 'Was I not enough?' 'Were they telling the truth?' 'What changed?'
examples: What changed for them so fast, and when did it start?
Did I miss obvious signs that this was not safe for me?
Was there someone else, or was it really just timing?

q23.title: What You Wish You Had Said or Done
q23.prompt: If you could go back to the last conversation with more calm and clarity, what would you say or do differently?
q23.placeholder: This is not for self-punishment. It is for learning.
examples: I would have stayed calm and asked direct questions instead of pleading.
I would have set a boundary and left sooner when the disrespect showed up.
I would have asked for a real conversation instead of trying to fix it by text.

q24.title: What Is Still Unresolved
q24.prompt: What is still unresolved or actively stressful right now? (Select any.)
examples: Belongings to return or retrieve + Social fallout (friends/community)
Money, debt, or financial disentangling + Housing transition
Nothing major unresolved

q25.title: Logistics Details (Optional)
q25.prompt: If there are unresolved logistics, what are they? (Short version is fine.)
q25.placeholder: Example: 'I need to pick up my things next week and I am anxious about seeing them.'
examples: We are separating finances and I do not know who is paying what this month.
I have to see them weekly for kid handoffs and it spikes my anxiety.
I still have items at their place and I am avoiding the pickup.

q26.title: Safety and Respect Inside the Relationship
q26.prompt: Only if you feel comfortable: were there any patterns that felt unsafe, coercive, or abusive?

options.label: Yes: emotional manipulation, intimidation, or control

examples: No
Maybe or not sure
Yes: emotional manipulation, intimidation, or control

q27.title: How Safe You Feel Right Now
q27.prompt: Right now, how safe do you feel in your day-to-day life (emotionally and physically)? If you are in danger, please prioritize real-world help first.
examples: Mostly safe, but shaken
Safe
Not safe

q28.title: If You Need Support, Where Can It Come From
q28.prompt: If you feel unsafe or close to your edge, what supports are available to you? If you feel safe, you can leave this blank.

fields.label: Who could you reach out to today?
Do you have a safe place you can go if needed?
Notes (optional)
fields.placeholder: Example: who, where, or what would help right now.

examples: Support: Friend + Family. Safe place: Yes, somewhere else.
Support: Therapist/coach. Safe place: Yes, my home feels safe.
Support: No one comes to mind. Safe place: Not really.

q29.title: What You Are Feeling Most
q29.prompt: What emotions are most present lately? (Select up to 6.)
examples: Grief + Loneliness + Yearning
Anger + Confusion + Anxiety
Relief + Sadness

q30.title: Intensity Right Now
q30.prompt: Right now in this moment, how intense is it? (0 to 10)

q31.title: How It Shows Up in Your Body
q31.prompt: When a wave hits, what do you notice in your body? (Select any that fit.)
examples: Tight chest or heart ache + Lump in throat
Restlessness or agitation + Stomach drop or nausea
Heavy fatigue + Sleepiness or shutdown

q32.title: Recent Triggers
q32.prompt: What has triggered the hardest waves recently?
q32.placeholder: Examples: seeing their name, certain places, nights, social media, anniversaries, loneliness.
examples: Seeing their social media and imagining them happy without me.
Driving past a place we used to go together.
Night time and weekends when I am alone.

q33.title: What Your Mind Keeps Replaying
q33.prompt: What does your mind keep replaying or looping on? (Select up to 5.)

options.label: What if I did something different

examples: Only the good memories + Imagining them moving on
The breakup conversation + Self-criticism
What if I did something different + Why I was not enough

q34.title: What You Miss (Ranked)
q34.prompt: What do you miss most? Select what fits and rank the top ones.

options.label: The future story I had in my head
I do not know, it is just pain

examples: The future story I had in my head, Companionship / having a person
Physical affection, Feeling chosen/validated
Shared routines, Specific traits (humor, warmth, etc.)

q35.title: What Hurt the Most (Ranked)
q35.prompt: What part hurt the most? Select what fits and rank the top ones.

options.label: Loss of the future we planned

examples: Loss of the future we planned, Rejection or feeling replaced
Betrayal or lies, Disrespect or being dismissed
Feeling like I betrayed myself, Abandonment (especially sudden)

q36.title: Sleep Lately
q36.prompt: How has sleep been since the ending?

options.label: Waking up early or during the night

examples: Hard to fall asleep
Waking up early or during the night
All over the place

q37.title: Eating and Appetite

options.label: Old patterns around food are coming back

examples: Less appetite
Comfort eating
Forgetting to eat

q38.title: Movement and Energy
q38.prompt: How has your movement or exercise been?

options.label: I feel stuck in my body

examples: Less than usual
More than usual (to cope)
Almost none

q39.title: Alcohol and Substances
q39.prompt: Since the ending, has your relationship with alcohol or substances changed? (Select any that fit.)

options.label: Increased use of prescription meds (as prescribed or not)
Relapse after a period of sobriety

examples: No change
Increased alcohol use + I feel concerned about it
Relapse after a period of sobriety

q40.title: Sex, Porn, or Validation Coping
q40.prompt: Only if you are comfortable: has any part of this pushed you toward sex, porn, or chasing validation as a coping strategy?

options.label: Yes, it feels compulsive or out of control
I am avoiding all intimacy out of fear

examples: A little
I am avoiding all intimacy out of fear
Prefer not to say

q41.title: Safety Check: Self-Harm Thoughts
q41.prompt: Have you had thoughts of hurting yourself since this ended? If you are in immediate danger, call your local emergency number or a crisis line right now.

options.label: Yes: passive thoughts (I wish I could disappear, but no plan)
Yes: active thoughts (I have thought about a plan)
Yes: I have acted on it recently

examples: No
Yes: passive thoughts (I wish I could disappear, but no plan)
Prefer not to say

q42.title: Safety Check: Risky Behavior
q42.prompt: Since the ending, have you done anything that scared you (reckless driving, unsafe mixing, unsafe situations, etc.)?
examples: No
A little
Prefer not to say

q43.title: Unhelpful Coping Patterns
q43.prompt: Which coping patterns are showing up (even if you wish they were not)? Select any. This is for awareness, not judgment.

options.label: Checking their social media or location

examples: Doomscrolling or excessive phone time + Checking their social media or location
Isolating from people + Self-attack/self-hate spirals
None of these

q44.title: Support Around You
q44.prompt: Who is actually in your corner right now? (Select any that apply.)

options.label: At least one friend I can talk to
No one I trust with this

examples: At least one friend I can talk to + Family support
Therapist + Support group
No one I trust with this

q45.title: Professional Support
q45.prompt: Are you getting support from a professional right now? If yes, what kind? If no, that is okay too.

fields.label: What kind of support?
If applicable, how often?
Notes (optional)
fields.placeholder: Example: modality (CBT/IFS/EMDR), what helps, what does not.

examples: Support: Therapist (licensed). Frequency: Weekly. Notes: CBT, helpful with thought spirals.
Support: None right now. Frequency: Not applicable.
Support: Clergy/faith counseling + Coach. Frequency: As needed.

q46.title: Medication Changes
q46.prompt: Only if relevant: have there been any recent changes in mental health medication (starting, stopping, dosage changes)?
examples: Not applicable
No change
Dose change

q47.title: What Helps and What Tools You Use
q47.prompt: What tools or actions actually give you even a little relief? (We are looking for what works, not what you think you should do.)

fields.label: What helps right now?
If you journal, what style fits you best?
Do you use any tracking tools?
Name any specific book, podcast, therapist style, or creator you are leaning on (optional)
fields.placeholder: Example: 'Attached', 'CBT worksheets', 'IFS therapy', a podcast name.

fields.label: Notes (optional)
fields.placeholder: What helps most, what makes it worse, what you want to try next.

examples: Helps: Walking / movement + Talking with a friend + Journaling. Journaling: Reality log. Tracking: Mood tracker. Resources: 'Attached'.
Helps: Prayer / spiritual practice + Breathwork / grounding. Journaling: Prayer / spiritual journal. Tracking: No. Resources: (blank).
Helps: Nothing feels helpful yet. Journaling: I do not journal. Tracking: No.

q48.title: Your Information Diet
q48.prompt: What are you feeding your brain right now? (Select all that apply. This helps us filter the noise.)

options.label: "How to get your ex back" or strategy content
Attachment theory or diagnosing them/me (avoidant, narcissist, etc.)
Tarot, astrology, manifestation, looking for signs
I am avoiding relationship content completely

examples: Structured grief/healing content + Pure distraction (comedy, gaming, unrelated topics)
"How to get your ex back" or strategy content + Attachment theory or diagnosing them/me (avoidant, narcissist, etc.)
I am avoiding relationship content completely

q49.title: Social Media and Checking Behaviors
q49.prompt: How often are you checking on them (social media, mutual friends, old photos, messages)?

options.label: I keep trying not to, but I slip

examples: I keep trying not to, but I slip
Blocked/removed to protect myself
Many times a day

q50.title: Boundaries You Are Willing to Try
q50.prompt: Which boundaries feel doable for you right now? (Select any. Even one is progress.)

options.label: Move photos to a hidden folder
Avoid certain places for a bit
Ask a friend to be a buffer/accountability
Schedule a daily grief window (so it does not own the whole day)

examples: Unfollow/mute/block on social media + Move photos to a hidden folder
Logistics-only messaging (short, neutral, necessary) + Ask a friend to be a buffer/accountability
None feel doable yet

q51.title: Daily Life Impact
q51.prompt: Which daily-life areas are taking a hit right now? (Select any.)
examples: Sleep routine + Work or school performance + Social life
Eating and hydration + Hygiene/self-care (shower, grooming)
I am functioning mostly okay

q52.title: Anything You Need to Say Out Loud
q52.prompt: If you want a place to unload: what do you most need to say about this right now?
q52.placeholder: You can vent. You can be messy. You can be short.
examples: I keep blaming myself and I am exhausted from it.
I feel replaced and it is humiliating, even though I know it is not logical.
I miss them, but I also know I was shrinking to make it work.

q53.title: Reality Check
q53.prompt: When your mind idealizes them, this helps balance the picture. You can keep it simple.

fields.label: What I miss (or what I wish was true)
What it cost me (or what was not okay)
One grounding sentence I can repeat
fields.placeholder: Example: 'Missing them does not mean going back is wise.'

examples: Miss: their warmth at night. Cost: constant anxiety and mixed signals. Anchor: Missing them does not mean this was safe.
Miss: the future story. Cost: I kept abandoning my needs. Anchor: I can grieve and still choose myself.
Miss: the friendship. Cost: disrespect in conflict. Anchor: Love without respect is not love I want.

q54.title: Red Flags You May Have Minimized
q54.prompt: Looking back gently, which red flags did you minimize or excuse?
examples: Inconsistency + Hot and cold behavior + Love-bombing then withdrawal
Disrespect in conflict + Stonewalling or silent treatment
None stand out

q55.title: Ownership vs Release
q55.prompt: This is one of the most healing distinctions. No self-attack. Just clarity.

fields.label: What I own (my part)
What I release (what is not mine)
One thing I will do differently next time
fields.placeholder: Example: 'Ask directly and set boundaries early.'

examples: Own: I stayed when I felt small. Release: their mixed signals. Next time: I will ask for clarity early.
Own: I avoided hard talks. Release: their choices. Next time: I will speak up sooner.
Own: I chased reassurance. Release: their inability to commit. Next time: I will pace myself.

q56.title: If They Came Back Tomorrow
q56.prompt: If they came back tomorrow wanting you again, what would be true for you?

fields.label: My honest openness to reconciling

options.label: No, I would not go back
Yes, I would want to try

fields.label: If reconciliation were ever on the table, what would it require?
Notes (optional)
fields.placeholder: Anything you want your future self to remember here.

examples: Open: Maybe, with major change. Require: Consistent actions over time + Therapy + Clear boundaries honored.
Open: No, I would not go back. Require: Not applicable.
Open: Not sure. Require: Full truth and transparency + A real apology and ownership.

q57.title: Spiritual and Faith Impact
q57.prompt: Some people are supported by faith, and others are triggered by it right now. Either is okay. What fits you?

fields.label: My baseline
How is this experience affecting your faith/spiritual view?

options.label: It is an anchor for me right now
I feel angry at God or full of doubt
I am trying to 'just have faith' so I do not have to feel the pain
I am praying for a specific outcome (bring them back, fix it, etc.)
My community/faith setting feels tense, judging, or unhelpful right now

fields.label: Notes (optional)
fields.placeholder: Example: what helps spiritually, what hurts, what you need from faith/community.

examples: Baseline: Religious (community-based). Impact: It is an anchor for me right now. Notes: Prayer calms my body.
Baseline: Spiritual but not religious. Impact: I feel angry at God or full of doubt. Notes: I feel abandoned.
Baseline: Both spiritual and religious. Impact: I am trying to 'just have faith' so I do not have to feel the pain.

q58.title: Closure Actions
q58.prompt: What closure actions feel realistic this week? (Small is fine. We are building traction.)

fields.label: Select any actions you are willing to take
When do you plan to do the first one?
Notes (optional)
fields.placeholder: What might get in the way, and what would help you follow through.

examples: Actions: Remove or reduce triggers + Start or reset no-contact. When: Tonight.
Actions: Write an unsent letter + Talk with a friend. When: Saturday afternoon.
Actions: Move my body + Set a simple sleep plan. When: Tomorrow morning.

q59.title: A Note to Future You
q59.prompt: Write a short note to your future self for the next wave. What do you want to remember?
q59.placeholder: Example: what is true, what you learned, what you deserve.
examples: This pain will pass in waves. Do not text them in a spike. Breathe first.
Missing them is not proof it was right. Choose peace over intensity.
You are allowed to grieve and still protect your boundaries.

q60.title: Thirty-Day Target
q60.prompt: If you could fast-forward 30 days and feel meaningfully better, what would be different?

fields.label: Select what you want to be true in 30 days

options.label: My faith/spiritual footing feels steadier (if relevant)
I feel clearer about why it ended
I feel ready to date again (if that is a goal)

fields.label: One clear sign I am healing is...
fields.placeholder: Example: 'I can go a day without checking.'

fields.label: Notes (optional)

examples: Goals: Sleep is steadier + Rumination is reduced + I kept my boundary/no-contact plan. Sign: I stop checking their profile.
Goals: My self-worth feels steadier + Joy is returning. Sign: I laugh without it feeling fake.
Goals: Not sure yet. Sign: I can breathe through a wave without panicking.
